page.title: 08FARMS IN HINTON CHARTERHOUSE
page.content: BEFORE DECEMBER 1984,{TYTHERLY FARM} COVERED 146 ACRES OF LAND. TWENTY FIVE ACRES WAS RENTED. CORN, WHEAT AND GRASS FOR COW FEED WAS GROWN. ALL THE COWS WERE{FRESIANS}WITH 1 BULL. IN DECEMBER 1984, THE FARM WAS SPLIT BETWEEN 2 SONS. ONE HALF WAS KEPT AS TYTHERLY BY ONE SON ;THE OTHER RENAMED HIS HALF{HILLSIDE.} TYTHERLY FARM NOW HAS 73 ACRES OF LAND. SEVENTY ACRES OF THIS ARE USED FOR GROWING CORN AND WHEAT, AND THE OTHER THREE ARE FOR GRASS TO KEEP THE GOODNESS IN THE SOIL. THIS FARM HAS A FARM HOUSE AND A FEW BARNS. HILLSIDE FARM ALSO HAS 73 ACRES OF LAND. ON THIS LAND ARE 73 FRESIAN COWS AND 1 BULL. THE FRESIANS ARE ALL USED FOR MILK. THE FARMHOUSE IS A MODERN BUNGALOW, AND THERE ARE ALSO A FEW BARNS USED FOR STORING WINTER FEED.
